title: Drawing, "An Army Camp (Soldiers Around a Campfire)", 1862–64
medium:
Recto: Graphite on cream-colored paper
Verso: Grapite, brush and gray wash on cream-colored paper
markings: Stamped in brown ink, at lower left edge: Cooper Union Museum for the Decorative Arts; Lugt 457d.
inscribed: Inscribed lightly in graphite, at center left:  L3 [ 23?]
creditline: Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.
description:
Recto:  Vertical full-length view of a bearded soldier, in cap and uniform, facing left and blowing a bugle with his right hand, while holding a sword in his left hand. Beside this study to the right is another three-quarter length view of solider, slightly larger in scale and turned to right.  

Verso:  Horizontal scene of an army camp with campfire and three soldiers in foreground; wagon train, wagons and mules in background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "An Army Camp (Soldiers Around a Campfire)", 1862–64.
1862–64. Recto: Graphite on cream-colored paper
Verso: Grapite, brush and gray wash on cream-colored paper. Gift of Charles Savage Homer, Jr.. 1912-12-115.
